column1: Mulchén is a city and commune in Bío Bío Province of Bío Bío Region
column2: Chile. It was first settled in 1871 by soldiers during the so-called Pacification of the Araucania. In 1875 Mulchén was officially founded.

column1: The city is surrounded by a meander of the Bureo River on all sides except the south
column2: where it is bounded by the Mulchén River. It is located 32 km south of the city of Los Ángeles

column1: According to the 2002 census of the National Statistics Institute
column9: 184 (24.8%) in rural areas. The population fell by 3.1% (931 persons) between the 1992 and 2002 censuses.

column2: Mulchén is a third-level administrative division of Chile administered by a municipal council
column3: headed by an alcalde who is directly elected every four years. The 2008-2012 alcalde is Francisco Jara Delgado (UDI).Within the electoral divisions of Chile
column4: Mulchén is represented in the Chamber of Deputies by Juan Lobos (UDI) and José Pérez (PRSD) as part of the 47th electoral district
column14: Laja and Alto Bío Bío). The commune is represented in the Senate by Victor Pérez Varela (UDI) and Mariano Ruiz -Esquide Jara (PDC) as part of the 13th senatorial constituency (Biobío-Coast).
